dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Microsoft Build opening keynote
description: Satya Nadella and Microsoft leaders share how Microsoft is creating new opportunity across our platforms in this era of AI.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Azure AI Foundry: The AI app and Agent Factory
description: Join Azure AI Foundry's flagship session. Learn how to supercharge your AI development with our integrated signals loop that connects model choice, knowledge retrieval, fine-tuning, orchestration and memory — anchored by observability and trust. Design, customize, and manage intelligent agents using open standards and protocols such as Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent-to-Agent (A2A) to connect with tools and drive collaboration. Gain insights into advanced orchestration, tracing, and monitoring to streamline decision-making, boost efficiency, accelerate time to market, and lower costs.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Build agent-first solutions with Power Platform and Copilot Studio
description: Join us on a journey to transform manual business processes to agent-led, human-supervised tasks using Copilot Studio and Power Apps. We'll use AI to define the business problem, map the processes, identify efficiency opportunities, and create a multi-asset solution including agents, apps, and automations. This approach combines no-code, low-code, and pro-code elements to speed up development and enhance creativity, reducing drudgery and delivering a working solution in record time.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: From legacy to cloud native: Accelerating Modernization at scale and AI
description: Unlock the future of app development by transforming legacy systems into agile, cloud-native solutions. In this session, we discover how to accelerate app modernization at scale using GitHub Copilot and Azure’s App Modernization Guidance. Learn how developers can offload complex and time-consuming tasks to rapidly update, upgrade, and modernize Java and .NET applications with AI. Transform your legacy systems into cutting-edge solutions that drive performance.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Reimagining Software Development and DevOps with Agentic AI
description: We are infusing Agentic AI into the entire Software Development Lifecycle—from brainstorming new ideas, implementing a plan, crafting new code, reviewing code, releasing software, to bringing insights back to the development team. See how GitHub Copilot is being reimagined through this entire lifecycle to boost productivity across teams.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Under the Hood: Optimizing Azure applications for performance and efficiency
description: Discover how to develop cost-effective, scalable, and high-performance applications using the latest features and internal options available in Azure Compute services. We discuss different CPU architectures provided by Azure, application patterns optimized for Intel, AMD, or ARM64, and performance benchmarking tooling. We also dive into OS-level recommendations including host networking settings and storage options like Azure Boost SSD.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: What's New in Microsoft Databases: Empowering AI-Driven App Dev
description: Explore advanced applications powered by Microsoft databases on-premises, on Azure and in Microsoft Fabric. Join CVP Shireesh Thota to uncover innovative approaches to scalability with high-performance tuning and partitioning. Boost resiliency with HADR capabilities and security, and learn about intelligent data processing with AI-driven insights and agentic integrations. See new features with engaging demos in SQL Server, Azure SQL, Azure Cosmos DB, and Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: VS Code, Live!
description: We're bringing VS Code, Live! for the first time ever, in person—and you’re on the guest list. Join us for a session filled with interactive demos, dev sneak peeks, and a behind-the-scenes look at all the latest announcements. No slides. Just code, conversation, and good vibes, plus a few surprises.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: An overview of Windows AI Foundry
description: Whether you're starting out with AI development or looking to enhance your skills, learn more about Windows AI Foundry and its capabilities. This session covers an end-to-end build, customization, testing, and deployment of AI across client and cloud environments. Bring your own model with Windows ML or choose from a rich catalog of OSS models with Foundry Local.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Data-intensive AI Training and Inferencing with Azure Blob Storage
description: Discover how Azure Storage powers OpenAI and Microsoft AI model training and end-user applications through seamless access to exabytes of unstructured data. Learn how Azure’s AI ecosystem integrates with Blob Storage using advanced features and APIs, and leverage tools like blobfuse2 and AzCopy to optimize training, fine-tuning, and inference pipelines for performance and cost.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Design scalable data layers for multi-tenant apps with Azure Cosmos DB
description: When building multi-tenant SaaS apps, developers must design for data isolation, scalability, and performance. Learn how Azure Cosmos DB delivers high performance and AI-readiness with features such as fleet management capabilities, materialized views, and global secondary indexes to deliver faster queries and resilient applications.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Develop, Build and Deploy LLM Apps using GitHub Models and Azure AI Foundry
description: With new foundational models emerging weekly, this demo-packed session shows you how to rapidly experiment with and compare LLMs using GitHub Models. Learn to build application functionality and scale production deployments with Azure AI Foundry, giving you the tools to integrate the latest AI models into your business.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Envision a secure, AI-accelerated developer experience with Docker
description: Software development is rapidly evolving—from securing the software supply chain to building AI-driven applications. In this session, see how Docker is enhancing security and enabling advanced workflows for AI development through live demos that showcase secure delivery and streamlined AI integration.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Foundry Local: Building cutting-edge on-device AI experiences
description: Build intelligent on‑device AI with Azure AI Foundry. Discover how seamless integration across CPU, GPU, and NPU—combined with the Azure AI Foundry Model catalog and inferencing APIs—delivers top performance and enhanced security for real-time processing, both locally and in the cloud.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Microsoft Fabric for Developers: Build Scalable Data & AI Solutions
description: Join Azure Data leadership to explore how developers can leverage Microsoft Fabric to build and scale integrated data and AI applications. Discover how this unified data platform brings together operational and analytical workloads through OneLake, enhanced CI/CD, and security workflows.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: What's new in Copilot Studio
description: Join us for an in-depth look at building agents in Copilot Studio with a special focus on the latest innovations and upcoming enhancements in 2025. Discover improvements in knowledge capabilities, generative orchestration, and new testing and debugging tools that highlight how Copilot Studio delivers tangible value.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Azure AI Foundry Agent Service: Transform agentic workflows
description: Faster, better, and at lower cost – discover how Azure AI Foundry Agent Service, integrated into Azure AI Foundry’s continuous signals loop, can revolutionize your business processes by enabling low latency, high scalability, and enterprise-grade AI agent management.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Better Microservices Development using Azure Container Apps
description: Life is hard. Building microservices doesn't have to be. In this code-focused talk, learn how to build and maintain distributed Container Apps with less time, effort, and pain. Watch live fixes for performance issues and discover insights into open-source tools like KEDA while exploring the capabilities of Azure Container Apps.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Build and scale your AI apps with Kubernetes and Azure Arc
description: Discover how Developer and DevOps teams can leverage unified tools and Azure services to build AI apps and deploy them on Kubernetes across distributed infrastructure. Learn how centralized app and infrastructure management drives continuous improvement and operational excellence.

dateTime: Tuesday, May 20 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Deploying an end-to-end secure AI application
description: Security can be challenging even at the best of times—especially when it isn’t your full-time job. This session walks you through the end-to-end deployment of a secure AI application, covering identities, virtual networks (VNETs), network security groups (NSGs), key vaults, prompt shields, and data labelling.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Unpacking the tech
description: Jay Parikh, Charles Lamanna, Scott Guthrie and friends will dig deeper into the news announced on Day 1, with a focus on the role developers play in helping enterprises successfully embrace AI and digital transformation, the latest in Copilot, Azure, GitHub, and Windows AI innovations, and the significance of trust, security, and governance in all we do.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Architecting your multi agent solutions with Copilot Studio and M365 Agents SDK
description: Multi-agent systems don’t need to be hard. In this session you will learn how to build and deploy your connected agents whether it's through Copilot Studio, Azure AI Foundry (Azure AI Agents) or Microsoft 365 Agents SDK using C#. Connecting agents, connecting data, and enabling transformational scenarios is what we’re all about.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Boost your app's reach and engagement with AI via App Actions on Windows
description: Unlock your app’s full potential with AI via App Actions on Windows! Learn how to register your app’s Actions to boost visibility and traffic and enhance user experiences by integrating rich actions from the Windows catalog.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building advanced agentic apps with PostgreSQL on Azure
description: What benefits do agentic architectures bring compared to traditional RAG patterns? In this session we explore advanced agentic capabilities offered by popular GenAI frameworks on top of Azure Database for PostgreSQL, along with enhancements like vector search acceleration via DiskANN and Semantic Ranking.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building real solutions with Real-Time Intelligence in Fabric
description: Today’s solutions are only as accurate and up to date as the data that powers them. Real-Time Intelligence in Microsoft Fabric leverages high-granularity data from connected systems to build real-time solutions using tools like Digital Twin Builder.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Developer essentials for agents and apps in Azure AI Foundry
description: Turn your AI ideas into production-ready solutions using a unified toolkit that seamlessly integrates Azure AI Foundry with VS Code, GitHub, and Copilot Studio. Experience faster development cycles with fewer bugs as you design and deploy intelligent apps.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Solving the Unsolvable: Advanced Agentic AI Models in Azure AI Foundry
description: What if AI could go beyond prediction—and truly reason and act? Explore next-gen models such as OpenAI’s o1 and o3 mini, computer-use agents, DeepSeek R1 and V3 in Azure AI Foundry. Learn how these models tackle complex, multi-step problems using techniques like chain-of-thought prompting.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 4:45 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Using the new App Service Premium v4 to build, deploy & scale web apps
description: Join us to learn what's new in Azure App Service Premium v4. Discover how to run a local SLM in a sidecar container, invoke an OpenAPI App Service web app via integration with Azure AI Agent Service, and employ best practices with ARM/Bicep templates.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Accelerating AI Startups: Build, Scale, and Go to Market
description: AI startups face challenges scaling and securing funding while deploying AI solutions. Hear from industry experts on utilizing Azure and Azure AI Foundry to overcome these challenges, optimize workflows, and navigate venture opportunities.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building Effective Agents with Microsoft 365 Copilot
description: Learn about the enterprise opportunity using the Agent Platform for Microsoft 365 Copilot. Discover the latest features for building agents via Agent Builder and how internal and customer examples illustrate transformative business outcomes.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Copilot Studio Agents & Azure AI Foundry: better together
description: Learn how to build agents in Copilot Studio with deep integration into Azure AI Foundry services. Leverage vectorized indices from Azure AI Search to perform retrieval-augmented generation and integrate over 1800 models from the Azure model catalog.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Inside Azure innovations with Mark Russinovich
description: Join Mark Russinovich, CTO and Deputy CISO of Microsoft Azure, as he takes you on a tour of the latest innovations in Azure architecture and explains how Azure enables intelligent, modern, and scalable applications at the edge and in the cloud.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Secure and scale your AI APIs with Azure API Management
description: Learn how AI gateway capabilities in Azure API Management help secure, govern, and optimize AI workloads by providing model protection, prompt filtering, request mediation, and cost control.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: SQL Server 2025: The Database Developer Reimagined
description: Discover how SQL Server 2025 redefines the database developer experience with new features such as vector search with AI models, a JSON type and index, RegEx enhancements, Change Event Streaming, and built-in REST API support, all deployable on multiple platforms.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 6:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Unleash on-device AI with Snapdragon X Series
description: Explore how Qualcomm is enabling a software ecosystem that helps AI developers easily target Snapdragon X Series. Learn about the partnership with Microsoft that delivers scalable and performant AI runtimes for on-device inference.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building Secure AI Agents with Microsoft Entra External ID
description: Learn how to build AI Agents for external-facing apps using the OpenAI SDK with Assistants and Function Calling for APIs secured by Microsoft Entra External ID, ensuring adherence to Zero Trust principles.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building the digital workforce: Multi-agent apps with Azure AI Foundry
description: Design a digital workforce that automates complex tasks and accelerates decision-making with Azure AI Foundry Agent Service, Semantic Kernel, and AutoGen. Develop multi-agent applications that collaborate like human teams to deliver speed, precision, and efficiency.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Enable seamless deployment across Intel Copilot+ AI PCs and Azure
description: Explore how Intel drives AI innovation from PC to data center, enabling seamless deployment across Windows Copilot+ AI PCs and Azure. Learn how Intel’s AI stack, with features like Quick Assist and ReFS compression, accelerates workflows on both endpoints and in the cloud.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Fastest & easiest way to integrate AI using Windows AI APIs
description: Learn how to leverage on-device machine learning models to elevate your AI experience by fine-tuning Windows ML with custom data, and building innovative capabilities like Semantic Search and Knowledge Retrieval using Windows AI APIs.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Fine-tuning and distillation with Azure AI Foundry
description: Enhance your AI models using advanced fine‑tuning and distillation techniques such as Direct Preference Optimization (DPO) and Reward Fine-Tuning (RFT) within Azure OpenAI, optimizing performance while reducing data requirements and costs.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: GitHub Copilot for Skeptics Who Still Think AI is Overrated
description: You've had just about enough of all this talk about AI for developers. It feels like a lot of hype, but the magic of AI for developers is very real. This session provides practical tips and tricks to unlock GitHub Copilot’s full potential.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Streamlining AKS Debugging: Techniques to solve common & complex problems
description: Learn to troubleshoot common and complex issues in AKS, such as solving DNS issues, determining processes consuming high CPU and memory, and resolving tricky network security-related problems with open-source tools.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 8:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: The Future of .NET App Modernization Streamlined with AI
description: Discover how GitHub Copilot Upgrade for .NET simplifies modernization of .NET apps directly from Visual Studio, with project analysis, automatic dependency management, and AI-assisted self-healing.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Best practices for building agentic apps with Azure AI Foundry
description: Master proven strategies for designing, coding, and deploying agentic applications that minimize errors, reduce development costs, and ensure scalable AI performance.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Build Microsoft Teams collaborative agents as virtual colleagues with Visual Studio Code
description: Explore how collaborative agents enhance teamwork in Microsoft Teams channels, meetings, and chats, actively driving productivity and creativity.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building secure agents with Azure AI Foundry and Microsoft Security
description: Discover new tools and best practices for deploying more secure, trustworthy GenAI applications, covering AI evaluations, threat modeling, and security controls.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: GenAI for Enterprise: Intelligent Apps and Agents with Dataverse & MCP
description: See how Dataverse serves as an agent-ready database that unifies data from enterprise systems with built-in vector indexing, supporting MCP for connected agent experiences.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Orchestrate E2E automation and build adaptive AI agents with UiPath
description: Discover how UiPath Maestro orchestrates AI agents, robots, and people for seamless automation, integrating with Microsoft Copilot Studio and LangChain agents.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Python Meets .NET: Building AI Solutions with Combined Strengths
description: Explore how Python and .NET can be combined to build AI-powered applications, leveraging the best of both ecosystems.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Shift Left: Secure Your Code and AI from the Start
description: Discover how to swiftly deliver intelligent applications while maintaining security, using AI-driven threat modeling and developer-focused security tools.

dateTime: Wednesday, May 21 at 9:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: What's Coming in Fabric Automation and CI/CD
description: Explore the latest updates in Fabric APIs, automation tools, and CI/CD enhancements, including new Terraform provider support.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Accelerating Scientific Discovery with HPC, AI, and Quantum Computing
description: Learn how HPC, AI, and Quantum Computing are transforming scientific research and enabling solutions to complex global challenges.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Collaborate with a team of agents to build intelligent solutions
description: Learn how Microsoft Power Platform enables agent collaboration throughout the development lifecycle, accelerating generative and intelligent solution-building.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Create agents for Microsoft 365 Copilot with Microsoft 365 Agents SDK
description: Learn how to build agents using Microsoft 365 Agents SDK, with custom orchestration and foundation models designed for multiple channels.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Improving App Health with Health Modeling and Chaos Engineering
description: Explore real-world scenarios in reliability engineering using Azure Monitor Health Models, Chaos Studio experiments, and structured health modeling.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Inside Azure AI Foundry Labs: Experimenting with the Future of AI
description: Discover how Azure AI Foundry Labs allows developers, startups, and enterprises to experiment with Microsoft's latest AI research before general availability.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Making Azure DevOps and GitHub Greater than the Sum of their Parts
description: Discover how new integrations between Azure DevOps and GitHub simplify workflows, making GitHub Copilot context-aware of Azure DevOps through the new MCP server.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Scale and secure MongoDB-compatible apps with Azure Cosmos DB
description: Learn how to migrate MongoDB workloads to Azure with zero downtime while enhancing security, scalability, and real-time sync via change data capture.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 2:00 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Under the hood and into the magic of GitHub Copilot
description: Join the GitHub Copilot team to explore how Copilot adapts to the evolving AI development landscape, including new models and patterns.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Beyond the Game: How AI and Data Are Powering the Future of Sports
description: See how AI and Azure Data are transforming sports analytics, enabling real-time insights for coaches, athletes, and teams.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Boost your app’s search: using Azure LLM functions with Elasticsearch
description: Integrate intelligent query rewriting, summarization, and scoring with Azure LLM functions in Elasticsearch for smarter search capabilities.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Build AI apps and unlock the power of your data with Azure Databricks
description: Learn how to deploy AI agents that reason over structured and unstructured data using Anthropic Claude 3.7 Sonnet in Azure Databricks.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building secure AI Agents with Azure Functions
description: Explore how durable functions, Logic Apps, LangChain, Semantic Kernel, and Azure Cosmos DB for vector storage enhance agentic AI security and automation.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Building Secure Business Apps: Best Practices for Design to Deployment
description: Discover best practices for securing and deploying business applications within Power Platform while ensuring responsible AI implementation with Purview and Copilot.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time

description: Gain insights into Copilot Studio deployment, monitoring, and maintenance for large-scale, customer-facing applications with multiple development teams.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Maximizing efficiency in cloud-native app design
description: Learn how Azure Container Apps enables dynamic, serverless pricing for cloud-native applications while scaling efficiently with KEDA and AKS Automatic.

dateTime: Thursday, May 22 at 3:30 AM Australian Eastern Standard Time
title: Use VS Code to build AI apps and agents
description: Learn how to explore different models, iterate on prompts, run evaluations, and build and deploy agents within VS Code using AI Toolkit and Azure AI Foundry.

description: Learn how GitHub Copilot for Azure, Azure Developer CLI (azd), and VS Code streamline app creation, deployment, troubleshooting, and cost optimization.

description: Learn how evaluation and continuous monitoring help iterate quickly and move AI agents from pilot to production using Azure AI Foundry and Azure Monitor.

description: Learn how to customize and fine-tune declarative agents for Microsoft 365 Copilot using Copilot Studio, automated data ingestion, and evaluation.

description: Learn how Azure Managed Redis improves AI application performance, enhances caching, and provides the latest .NET abstractions for boosting speed.

description: Learn how AI-driven tools simplify Java app modernization, from assessment to deployment, embedding intelligence via Spring AI and LangChain4j.

description: Explore the latest GitHub Copilot features in Visual Studio 2022 that streamline workflows, optimize productivity, and enhance development efficiency.

description: Discover how Arm and Microsoft are delivering breakthrough price-performance with Cobalt 100 VMs on Azure, including AKS on Arm.

description: Explore how .NET Aspire integrates AI, enhances workflows, and streamlines cloud-native application development.

description: Discover how Microsoft Fabric unifies operational and analytical data estates to power custom AI applications.
